title: You guys didn’t really do much for Ezreal’s old skins. Why is that?
body:
After looking at he older skin for the Ezreal update, I gotta say, you guys didn’t really put much effort into them. I don’t play Ezreal but looking at the old skins, there isn’t much love put into them and I kinda feel sorry for Ezreal mains. There’s going to be comments saying “it’s pbe, it’s going to change” but there is such a high chance that it won’t. I just hope this becomes big and riot will actually change them. 


Frosted Ezreal would’ve had such great frosty effects on them, but instead uses Base Effects.
Striker Ezreal’s new W should’ve used a soccer ball and should’ve had an kicking animation. 
Nottingham Ezreal ult should’ve had a Brown/Nature-ish green bow instead of blue to represent old school/fantasy genres.
Anything before Debonair/Ace of Spades (don’t know which came first) should’ve had at least something unique other than their joke. 

If you look at newer reworks, like say the {{champion:20}} rework. Each skin has a unique Snowball, Grungy Nunu and Willump has a Toy Ball, Demolisher has a metal ball and TPA has their logo.

All Star {{champion:84}}  shuriken is a soccer ball with kunai’s and Stinger changed her passive to yellow. 

It’s these little things that make it fun and awesome to use these skins and I hope these changes come through and I really like the Ezreal update too.

Edit: I forgot to mention about Pulsefire Ezreal, which for me I think is a successful rework skin. Looking at the little touches like his recall is what adds some ‘spicyness’ Into this skin. If you put much love and effort into Pulsefire, you have to put much love and effort into his other old skins too.

replies.body:
The reason is likely that Ezreal just has a ton of skins,with freaking 11 skins(including an ultimate one).
This means that they had to put much more work into his skins than they had for the previous VGUs.

I guess that would make sense. However if you think about the {{champion:25}} and {{champion:10}} rework, that's 17 skins being reworked all together (Kayle has 9, Morgana has 8). That being said, it's going to be released early next year but that's still going to be a lot of skins being reworked. 

Half of Ezreal's skins are real old, and like what they did with {{champion:20}} and {{champion:84}}, their 520 skins have some unique VFX. The other half are more recent and modern which I understand took more time. But I just wanted to know like why they added little touches to 520 skins to Akali and Nunu rework, but not on Ezreal?

I'm pretty sure that Kayle and Morgana have a bigger budget for their update as any other single VGU.They are after all 2 different champions,so they likely take as much resources as 2 individual reworks would require.

The same applied to Xayah and Rakan as well,they pretty much required as much work as 2 individual champions(which was why we didn't get a champ in febuary of that year).

Also while some of the older skins for Nunu and Akali got some touch-ups you can actually see that Nunu was kind of stretching the limits already with his skins,since his demolisher skin is lacking unique animations and VFX,despite 975.(even if every skin got their own snowball in exchange)
Im more annoyed that the ult skin has the least flashy ult skill.

i understand the barely changing the other skins cause just recolored 520 on only a minor visual update(cept W)

Times change, Riot's capabilities of making skins has improved. Look at the Alien Invader Heimer skin vs the Dragon Trainer or just look at any of Corki's skins vs Arcade.

They've done a lot to add to Pulsefire to make it worthy of the price tag, when the last version didn't compare to Elementalist Lux or even a good Legendery.
